content.description: Low-angle face climbing past three bolts.
content.location: This is the last route on the right when hiking up the grotto from the descent gully (or the first route on the left when approaching from Split Rock)

content.description: Approach the actual route by first scrambling up to the top of a block in front of the wall.  Follow the fun, steep, juggy face to the top.
content.location: Directly across the Grotto from Pacman/Gameboy. Approach the route by actually scrambling up the Grotto for about 20 feet from these routes before crossing over. Superfly is the middle of three routes on this formation. Wonder Woman (5.10C), Superfly (5.10A) , Air Ranger (5.10C)Â  )(routes from left to right).

content.description: Located right of the huge block 30 ft above the streambed on the approach to Java Wall. Scramble up the easy, but chossy 5th class wall below and right of the block. After stick clipping the first bolt, climb through a bouldery crux.
content.location: Right of Junior and Little Giant.

content.description: "Stinger" (5.9) is located in the Grotto between Slammer and Lowrider. Follows the steep left trending ramp and face to a headwall crux. Numerous edges and pockets throughout. Instantly popular moderate that is in the shade all day.
content.location: The Grotto, between Slammer (5.10b) and Lowrider (5.10b). Rappell from a 2-ring anchor.

content.description:
THE NORTH FACING, SOUTH SIDE OF THE GROTTO HAS BEEN POSTED AND CLOSED TO PROTECT ENDANGERED PLANTS!!!

The Park Service has ignored climbing activity at Echo Cliffs with the expectation that climbers would police themselves, but activities such as dogs at the base of the cliff, trash, tissue paper/feces, and loud music have put climbers on notice and on the radar.
content.location: Climbs upstream, on the south side of The Grotto, from "Game Boy" have been removed, posted, and closed.

content.description: After clipping the first bolt, traverse right and climb up the right arete using large holds on the left face.
content.location: On the right side of the Grotto, between "Intensity" and "Stinger." Begins under the overhang.

content.description:
Climbs the slab & 4 ft. roof on the wall left of the descent trail 50 feet before the streambed

and the Grotto are reached, 60 feet left of Miss Pacman. Powerful and sequential. Belay right

from the descent trail.

FA: Ben Chapman & Mark Ingram (May 2009)
content.location: 60 feet left of Miss Pacman on the approach trail.

content.description:
ROUTE CLOSED DUE TO SENSITIVE/ENDANGERED PLANT HABITAT

Puffing Hunchback begins with a short overhanging finger crack on the wall right of Game Boy. Above the 2nd bolt the route continues up on small flakes and edges. After the 3rd bolt Puffing Hunchback moves left and passes over a bulge just right of the arete. Continue up the steep wall on small friable looking flakes to the anchor.
content.location: Puffing Hunchback is located ten feet right of the Game Boy. It is directly behind you, 30 ft., as you face Lowrider.

content.description: Lower angle face climbing leads to a ledge and a good rest.  A short, steep headwall with a side-pulling crux leads to the cold shuts.
content.location: Located on a large, free-standing boulder down in a hole, across from Pacman/Gameboy.  Nimrod is the right-hand of 2 routes.

content.description: ROUTES ON THE NORTH FACING SOUTH SIDE OF THE GROTTO HAVE BEEN REMOVED, POSTED, AND CLOSED. The park service has deemed that there are endangered plants on the north facing faces of The Grotto that need to be protected. Also, the Park Service has ignored climbers at Echo Cliffs, but recent activities such as dogs at the base of the cliff, trash, tissue paper/feces, fire pits, and loud music have been observed and climbers are on notice and on the radar.
content.location: All routes upstream from "Game Boy" on the south side of the Grotto have been closed.

content.description: Climb up the left side of the face, just left of Game Boy, to anchors shared with Game Boy.
content.protection: 5 bolts, open shut anchors shared with Game Boy (the climb to the right).
content.location: This climb is in the Grotto, the first climbing area encountered on the approach trail. This climb is on a small wall on the near (west) side of the canyon, the opposite side of most of the other climbs. Miss Pacman is the leftmost of two climbs on this wall.

climbs.name: Mirror of Erised
climbs.fa: Ben Chapman, Pam Neal, & Tony Bird (August 2008)

content.description: "Mirror of Erised" climbs the steep arete on the right side of the huge block that sits above the streambed at the entrance to the Grotto. Begin in "the pit" and climb the right side of the narrow face, past 3 bolts to the horizontal break before pulling onto and climbing the arete, past 3 more bolts, right of "Nimrod" and left of "Junior."
content.location: Mirror of Erised is located on the right side of the huge block perched above the entrance to the Grotto. Between Nimord & Junior.

content.description: Steep, sequential and pumpy.  Diagonal up and right past the crux.  Easier climbing then leads to a large ledge.
content.protection: 3 bolts to 2 open shuts.  Not a bad route to stick clip.
content.location: The first of 4 closely spaced routes encountered on the right when walking up the Grotto from the descent Gully.

content.description: Climb up the right side of the block, to the left of Little Giant, past three bolts. Some fun arete moves.
content.protection: 3 bolts to open shut anchors shared with Junior.
content.location: This route is on a small block with two routes on the right edge of the Grotto, near the Left Flank (see Echo Cliffs photo). Scramble up ledges below and to the right of the block to approach. Little Giant is the rightmost of the two routes.

content.description: Climb up the left side of the block, to the left of Little Giant, past three bolts.
content.protection: 3 bolts to open shut anchors shared with Little Giant. It is a good idea to stick climb the first bolt: the crux is getting to the first bolt, and if you fall before the first clip you could tumble off a cliff.
content.location: This route is on a small block with two routes on the right edge of the Grotto, near the Left Flank (see Echo Cliffs photo). Scramble up ledges below and to the right of the block to approach. Junior is the leftmost of the two routes.

content.description: After clipping the first bolt, move left to the arete and climb over the bulge using hard to see pockets. Action packed for its size.
content.location: In the Grotto, on the north side, between Xanadu and Stinger.

content.description: ROUTE CLOSED TO PROTECT ENDANGERED PLANTS. The Park Service has deemed that the all routes on the north facing, south side of the GROTTO are critical habitat and the routes have been removed, posted, and closed.
content.location: Routes upstream from "Game Boy," on the south side of the Grotto, have been closed.

content.description: Start from a boulder in the stream. Climb up along the arete. At the top, go left to the anchors shared with Miss Pacman.
content.location: This climb is in the Grotto, the first climbing area encountered on the approach trail. This climb is on a small wall on the near (west) side of the canyon, the opposite side of most of the other climbs. Game Boy is the rightmost of two climbs on this wall.

content.description: "Dipstick" is the left most of the three routes on the huge orange block that sits above the entrance to the Grotto. Start climbing in the pit below the block and climb up tensiony 5.11 moves on sidepulls and underclings to a rest on the horizontal break. After lingering here, punch through the powerful headwall crux.
content.location: Left most route on the huge block perched above and north of the streambed, on the approach to the Grotto.

content.description: Climb the steep face to the right of the black water streak. After clipping the second bolt move right and pull the overlap on positive holds and pockets onto the upper headwall. Battle the pump to the anchors on the slightly overhung headwall.
content.location: Ten feet right of "Rats & Bats," and just right of the black water streak.

content.description: Climb the blunt arete to the right of Superfly.  Expect some unpleasant rock and some awkward climbing.  Not as fun as Superfly, but worthwhile if you are already climbing the cool 10a next door.
content.location: Directly across the Grotto from Pacman/Gameboy. Approach the route by actually scrambling up the Grotto for about 20 feet from these routes before crossing over.
